It was initially created to be able to easily backup or create a distributable copy of an Ubuntu or derivative installation. Inspiration for this tool came from the <tt>[[mklivecd]]</tt> script that Mandriva uses and the <tt>remasterme</tt> script that is in [[PCLinuxOS]]. Since those scripts are not very easy to port to ubuntu, it was created from scratch. It is very useful to create a customized Live CD/DVD version of Ubuntu, one just as to install ubuntu, install all the programs needed, including codecs, etc... install updates (recommended), and then install and run the script to create a Live CD/DVD with much more functionality than a original Ubuntu Live CD, the resulting [[ISO_image|iso]] can also the later installed in a USB pendrive, creating a [[Live_USB|LiveUSB]] distro [http://www.pendrivelinux.com/2007/09/28/usb-ubuntu-710-gutsy-gibbon-install/].
